title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.10 - Computing time
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.10 - Computing time

State Regulations
(a) In
computing the time period for filing a paper under these rules, the day the
period begins to run is not included. The last day of the period is included, unless it is a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday, in which case, the period
runs until the end of the next day which is not a Saturday, Sunday, or legal
holiday. (b) If a period of time
prescribed by these rules is measured from the service of any paper other than
a petition, and service is by mail, five days shall be added to the prescribed
period. (c) If a period of time
prescribed by these rules is measured from the service of any paper other than
a petition, and service is by overnight delivery, one day shall be added to the
prescribed period. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
65.10

Adopted

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
